image.altText: QPS Constables Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold

props.synopsis: It's the fifth and final week of an inquest into the 2022 tragedy, which claimed the life of two police officers and a neighbour.

title.children: Ballistic police vest would not have saved officer killed at Wieambilla, inquest hears

image.altText: High view of detention centre

props.synopsis: Queensland's Inspector of Detention Services has investigated youth detention in the state and made 15 recommendations to address human rights concerns.

title.children: Inspector finds children locked in rooms with no toilet or running water at Queensland youth detention centre

image.altText: CCTV shows a man in a cap and button up running away.

props.synopsis: The baby boy was with his family in a park at Stones Corner when an unknown man allegedly approached them and poured boiling coffee over the infant.

title.children: Police seeking man after boiling coffee was thrown at baby in Brisbane park

image.altText: A microbat on a towel

props.synopsis: Queensland rangers are investigating after 48 little bent-wing bats were found with "horrendous" injuries in a tunnel on a popular Sunshine Coast walking track.

title.children: Arsonists torch and kill dozens of microbats in 'shocking' act of cruelty

image.altText: Man and a woman stand and look back to their house, they are wearing purple shirts.

props.synopsis: Glenn and Linda Watson's daughter was murdered by her ex-partner. They hope by sharing her story they can save other lives.

title.children: Murdered woman's parents speak out as small towns grapple with hidden violence problem

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: The US and UK elections this year are proving to be significant flex points, and that has consequences for us in Australia. But it also shows how clear values are the only workable response to chaos.

title.children: Australia is labouring through wrenching transitions, and there's only one way out of the chaos

image.altText: A man smiling holding a glass

props.synopsis: The family of 61-year-old Dale Cook say they are "devastated" by his disappearance, as police on foot with dogs resume their search of dense bushland nearby.

title.children: 'Grave fears' held for Toowoomba man missing since walk near home 18 days ago

image.altText: A pathway on a bridge sitting above the Brisbane River with buildings in the distance.

props.synopsis: The Neville Bonner Bridge, which connects the Queen's Wharf precinct in the Brisbane CBD to South Bank, is expected to cater to 10,000 pedestrians each day.

title.children: Cyclists, scooter riders banned ahead of new Brisbane bridge's opening

image.altText: Woman standing in front of bookstore

props.synopsis: The plan to bring a supermarket giant into a small country town on Queensland's Sunshine Coast could spiral into a major legal battle.

title.children: Developer vows to fight for supermarket in small hinterland town, as proposal causes division

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: Polls put Kamala Harris slightly ahead of Donald Trump in the US election race. But there are two potential stumbling blocks that could up-end the contest once again.

title.children: Kamala Harris is ahead of Donald Trump, but two big wildcards could up-end the race

image.altText: Bentinck Island fish traps from the air

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say World Heritage listing would help preserve Australia's largest archaeological site, an elaborate network of stone walls designed to trap fish at low tide in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

title.children: Calls to protect northern Australia's ancient stone wall fish traps from tourists, climate change

image.altText: A young child gets their nose blown.

props.synopsis: Free flu vaccine has been available to Queenslanders for the past two years but the state’s influenza cases are more than double the five-yearly average.

title.children: Vaccination uptake declining despite Queensland government's $47m free vaccine program

image.altText: A cassowary runs towards hte camera

props.synopsis: Wildlife rangers are urging visitors not to feed cassowaries after shooting video of a pair of the big and potentially dangerous birds getting too close for comfort.

title.children: Warning as 'bold' cassowaries pester north Queensland campers for food

image.altText: A weathered hand holding a blue sparkly boulder opal.

props.synopsis: Opal miners are concerned about the future of their industry as the Queensland government buys a former cattle property used for mining. With 50 per cent of the region's opals coming from this one property, it's raising alarm bells.

title.children: Is the golden age of outback opal hunters coming to an end?

image.altText: A man stands in a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Transcripts obtained by the ABC show a soccer-loving businessman behind LNP election donations told a court he helped introduce Queensland's opposition leader to run a training company that later collapsed.

title.children: Entrepreneur behind LNP donations backed David Crisafulli to head training company, court documents reveal

image.altText: A man in a hospital bed with tubes going into his nose and mouth.

props.synopsis: Hepatitis C attacked Dennis Maby's liver over two decades and nearly claimed his life. Now clear of the disease he's urging other people to get tested.

title.children: 70,000 Australians are estimated to be needlessly living with Hep C. They also likely don't know they have it

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a beige and brown patterned shirt stands at a lectern, with four Pacific leaders behind him.

props.synopsis: Australia has notched a strategic victory in the Pacific after its peak gathering of leaders endorsed a $400 million major new initiative to reshape policing across the region.

title.children: Strategic victory for Australia as Pacific leaders back policing initiative that could block China

image.altText: two men in suits

props.synopsis: The new president says there needs to be a "conversation" about the number of jobs police are called out to, as domestic violence rates and attrition within the force soar.

title.children: 'Our police are at breaking point': New Queensland Police Union president says other agencies need to 'do their job'

image.altText: A man named Clifford Sunfly stands in front of a Toyota four-wheel drive.

props.synopsis: Ravaged by drug abuse, rampant unemployment and deep social dysfunction, Balgo is one of Australia's most remote communities. But there are opportunities on the horizon, as a community with ancient traditions looks to a modern future.

title.children: In Balgo, getting people into work is the battle. But locals are working hard to drive change

image.altText: a zoomed in woolworths sign

props.synopsis: Inflation has slowed to 3.5 per cent in the year to July, the latest data from the Bureau of Statistics has revealed, while Woolworths' annual profit plunged 93 per cent due to a massive write-down in the value of its New Zealand supermarkets, and the Australian share market recovered from its earlier drop.

title.children: Inflation slows to 3.5pc, Woolworths profit slumps, ASX recovers from earlier drop — as it happened

image.altText: About a dozen student are seen talking in a courtyard, in front of a tall sandstone clock tower at the University of Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The federal government's plan to cap international student numbers has split the tertiary education sector, drawing uproar from prestigious urban universities but cautious optimism from their regional and suburban competitors.

title.children: The ancient military strategy used by the government to push through international student caps

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

props.synopsis: Australia's peak energy user group and one of its biggest retailers sound the alarm on complex power prices, saying they're not working and may be harming.

title.children: Consumers are 'punished' by cost-reflective power prices, yet they do little of what they're supposed to do

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and wearing glasses looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: What was meant to be a dream holiday in Japan for Cassandra Nichterlein and her young family turned into a costly nightmare when their return flight from Japan was cancelled.

title.children: A family was left $7,000 out of pocket after a flight cancellation. Jetstar initially offered them $600

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars worth of Australian $50 notes showing David Unaipon

props.synopsis: New analysis released by the super industry has found one in four workers is missing out on compulsory superannuation payments, with women and those in lower-paid jobs worst hit.

title.children: 'Leaves people poorer when they retire': Could you be missing out on super payments?

image.altText: A soldier and a civilian man having a conversation

props.synopsis: The IDF says it rescued Arab Bedouin citizen of Israel Qaid Farhan Alkadi, 52, "in a complex operation in the southern Gaza Strip".

title.children: Israel rescues 52-year-old hostage taken in October 7 terror attack

image.altText: A demonstrator reacts as he holds a cutout of Indonesian President Joko Widodo

props.synopsis: One thing is clear: Indonesia's democrats will not let their hard-won system of checks and balances be dismantled without a fight.

title.children: Lobster rolls, nepotism and the 'Javanese king': Why Indonesians are 'deadnaming' President Jokowi

image.altText: Lousie Sauvage

props.synopsis: The journey of the Paralympics from a forgotten event to a global sensation has been a long and frustrating one, but these five athletes help tell the story of how we've arrived at Paris 2024.

title.children: Trailblazing and rebellion — the five women that tell the story of Australia's journey at the Paralympics

image.altText: Trump christians pic

props.synopsis: A revised indictment is filed against former US president Donald Trump in the case involving alleged interference of the 2020 US election.

title.children: Donald Trump faces revised US indictment in election subversion case

image.altText: Men play on a footy field

props.synopsis: This bush footy competition brings hundreds of people to Alice Springs from remote communities each year, but a council ban means they will no longer be able to play finals in town.

title.children: Alice Springs council declares two-year ban on bush footy finals amid crime fears

image.altText: Angie Ballard in racing wheelchair faces down wearing helmet and glasses, on a racing track.

props.synopsis: As she heads into an incredible seventh Paralympic Games, wheelchair racing champion Angie Ballard reflects on her journey to get here and her feelings about leading the Australian team into Paris.

title.children: From panic attacks to sponsorship woes, Paralympic champion Angie Ballard has overcome challenges for her seventh Games

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell in action for the Rabbitohs

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell has addressed the controversy surrounding a photo which circulated on social media appearing to show him in the presence of white powder.

title.children: 'Poor decisions': Latrell Mitchell reveals regret in first public comments since white powder controversy

image.altText: A woman holds her child with a demolished home in the background

props.synopsis: As many as 700,000 people are expected to attended an outdoor mass with Pope Francis next month in Dili, so authorities are bulldozing the homes of about 200 of the city's poorest residents to make room.

title.children: 'They've destroyed our homes': Ana Bela's house was bulldozed to make way for a mass with the pope

image.altText: Boeing starliner

props.synopsis: With NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded aboard the ISS for months, a decorated former astronaut tells the ABC they would know and have trained for the risks but the view is definitely worth it.

title.children: NASA's astronauts now aboard the ISS face 'untold consequences' for their future
